required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Changes in the MRI Signal in Patients With Benign Tumors of the Brain and Meninges Treated With Proton Therapy: Impact of TEL and the Biological Dose Received
clinical_study.official_title: Changes in the MRI Signal in Patients With Benign Tumors of the Brain and Meninges Treated With Proton Therapy: Impact of TEL and the Biological Dose Received

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective is to detect with TESLA multiparametric 3 MRI, the MRI secondary changes to protontherapy irradiation and to correlate them with TEL mapping, physical dose and biological dose. A model should thus be able to be proposed at the end of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate by TESLA multiparametric 3 MRI the modifications of the MRI signal :Change from Baseline at 1, 3 and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: modifications of the MRI signal on the various sequences carried out, during the study

arm_group.description: Patients will be followed by 3 Tesla MRIs during the study

intervention.description: 1.5 Tesla MRIs, usually used as pre-treatment and, between 3 and 6 months after irradiation, are replaced in the study by 3 Tesla MRIs (pre-treatment and at 6 months) In addition, two additional MRIs, also performed with a 3 Tesla magnetic field, will be performed: During treatment when half of the prescribed dose has been delivered. 1 month after the end of the irradiation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically proven or highly probable grade I meningiomas, histologically proven grade II meningiomas.
- Only meningiomas of the anterior and middle floors of the base of the skull are included.
- Indication of proton therapy retained in RCP and / or proton therapy technical staff (Caen site)
- Patient aged 18 or over
- Patient affiliated to a social security scheme
- Signature of informed consent before any specific procedure related to the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of brain or face irradiation.
- Implant or foreign body that can alter MRI imaging.
- Contraindication to MRI (pace maker, claustrophobia ...) - Hypersensitivity to gadoteric acid, to meglumine or to any medicine containing gadolinium
- Genetic radio sensitizing syndrome
- Known neurological comorbidities (stroke, Parkinson's, etc.) that may impact MRI data.
- Simultaneous participation in a therapeutic clinical trial
- Patient unable to undergo the trial follow-up for geographic, social or psychopathological reasons
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Persons deprived of their liberty (see article L 1121-6 CSP),
- Adults who are the subject of a legal protection measure or unable to express their consent (see article L 1121-8)
